urls.title: 'Shocking': Hazardous waste in fertiliser linked to catastrophic loss of dairy herd
urls.description: The Environment Agency has confirmed that it is investigating the loss of an entire dairy herd, which reports have linked to liquid fertiliser containing hazardous waste, including pharmaceuticals and petrochemicals.

tweets.text: 'Shocking': Hazardous waste from sewage sludge used as fertiliser linked to catastrophic loss of dairy herd, and where's the @EnvAgency report on pollution and health risks from sewage sludge? https://t.co/J2R488jWuX via @theENDSReport

@syonist @GeologyCharlie @PensanaRE remember talking to people in the last century who had shovelled sulphur from ships in Hull docks; this stuff will be palletised of course but thought those days of not asking public health questions were behind us, apparently not

urls.title: Bathing Water Quality
urls.description: Bathing waters are key locations at a beach where the highest number of people swim and paddle. The water quality is tested regularly in the summer months (May to September) at these designated areas by the Environment Agency to check on the levels of harmful bacteria and other pollutants in the water. Tests are carried out at 25 bathing waters in Dorset and 8 bathing waters in East Devon. The bathing water quality is classified using the Revised Bathing Water Directive based on the amount bacteria in

tweets.text:
@DrMickSalt @PHE_uk @EnvAgencyMids I wonder if they look at the difference between outdoor exposure Vs exposure indoors when it's been trapped in an unventilated house all night? ü§î

#StopTheStink
@DrMickSalt @PHE_uk @EnvAgencyMids Is there a long term exposure level of more than 90 days. I would say we are at that point or very close to.
@DrMickSalt @PHE_uk @EnvAgencyMids @pow_rebecca Answer on a postcard please, if you struggle with the chemistry let me know and I will get a 12 year old to explain it to you

domain.name: Person
domain.description: Named people in the world like Nelson Mandela

domain.name: Politician
domain.description: Politicians in the world, like Joe Biden

tweets.text: @DrMickSalt @PHE_uk @EnvAgencyMids Medium term is 15-90 days and so should already have been applied from 11th March. We are now beyond 90 days of AQM and so presumably long term exposure durations, especially if you take into account increased complaints which began in December and so six months ago!

The 2021 Bathing Waters season started on 15 May. Swimfo (https://t.co/h0zGIZ3P1O) helps everyone get the most out of a visit to a beach, lake or river by providing immediate access to information on over 400 designated bathing waters, so do have a look!

#WaterSavingWeek https://t.co/ytPtwmymaO

#StopTheStink: @PHE_uk and @EnvAgencyMids, since this is now a medium-term issue (90-days), why is the more stringent WHO tolerability of 20 Œºg m¬Ø¬≥ hydrogen sulphide not applied when considering respiratory effects? (Ref: Page 5 of https://t.co/0IJ1VGs9pk) https://t.co/tkqsRQ1FxM

We have reviewed the application to the @EnvAgency for tunnel approval. The document and the supporting reports are missing critical borehole logs and reports around the sensitive R Misbourne crossing locations at Chalfont St Giles and Shardeloes Lake. Why????

Many thanks to the teams at @rnli_teddington  @ChiswickRNLI and @EnvAgency; our colleagues at @BDMLR @LondonPortAuth and @ZSLWhipsnadeZoo  and special thanks to the team at @_LNSLTD for fantastic help and support last week. Great group effort in difficult circumstances... https://t.co/nZqDC1Pi5A
Please could you publish the actions that the operator must take by 1st June? Are these just recommendations or an official enforcement notice? https://t.co/VsLn1sTnP2

We were out doing unannounced site visits in #Ashford #Kent with @kentpolicerural @BTPKent @AshfordCouncil and @WeAreOpenreach checking site compliance whilst keeping an eye out for stolen cable and catalytic converters. https://t.co/8w3pUgAxJU

urls.title: What makes something smell good or bad?
urls.description: Mmmmmmm. That smells delicious. Wait, how do you know that?

tweets.text: @DeniseO97662017 @DrMickSalt @HelenVi00175623 @EnvAgency @StinkStopthe We were talking yesterday about what bad smell signals, why we identity something as smelling bad & what it means. Came across this Conversation piece for kids & guess what, hydrogen sulphide is described here as poisonous https://t.co/elRJYmZWpU

@HelenVi00175623 @EnvAgency @StinkStopthe Using WHO guidelines for H2S is a smokescreen. It's impossible to measure with accuracy the effects of molecules of H2S on every adult and child for every minute of the day and night. The agencies need to act on the high volume of complaints and symptoms. That's the evidence.

Just a thought... If the 4600ppm figure was inside the pipes last May. And then 1200ppm outside was this year... How much H2S is inside the pipes at the moment. Are those figures loads higher than last year? If yes why? If no are they leaking a quarter of their gas into the air?

urls.title: EXCLUSIVE: EA‚Äôs new river monitoring plans will ‚Äòdecimate‚Äô sampling network
urls.description: Environment Agency (EA) plans to overhaul its river quality monitoring regime by introducing a new system that monitors water quality at randomly selected sites have been branded a ‚Äúload of rubbish‚Äù by staff working at the regulator who fear that the strategy will ‚Äúdecimate‚Äù existing sampling capacity.

tweets.text: Very interesting Q&A in this month's @H2Oconservators  talk. The @EnvAgency is now so starved of funds that its sampling of inland water is in danger of not being statistically significant. Either we need to refund the EA or we should use remote monitors. https://t.co/FyUxQ3NJ83

@poppers82 @RedIndustries2 @ClareDinnisEA @pow_rebecca @EnvAgencyMids It will get sorted when we all have to be evaluated to prove a point!!!
EA are incompetent, bet if it was in there Area it would be shut down!!

tweets.text: Update for my residents in Ravensbury ward and others regarding the  oil spillage investigation in the River Wandle. My officers tell me the investigation was not conclusive; water quality often adversely affected by road runoff after heavy rainfall, according to @EnvAgency.

tweets.text: @BrazierMary We have reviewed the application to the @EnvAgency for tunnel approval. The document and the supporting reports are missing critical borehole logs and reports around the sensitive R Misbourne crossing locations at Chalfont St Giles and Shardeloes Lake.

urls.title: Mayor makes first speech at the Future Fens Taskforce | Cambridgeshire & Peterborough Combined Authority
urls.description: Mayor Dr Nik Johnson made his first speech at the Future Fens Taskforce yesterday (19th May 2021) Hello everyone. I‚Äôm Dr Nik Johnson. People know me as Dr Nik and since May 10 the Mayor of the Combined Authority.¬†I‚Äôm delighted to be able to join you at this Future Fens event, the first formal event [‚Ä¶]

tweets.text: Delighted to have given my first official speech to the #FutureFensTaskforce. #Compassion #Cooperation #Community in action ‚Äòin what is at its very heart a project of collaboration ‚Äì water companies, @EnvAgency, @WaterREast with all of its partners. More: https://t.co/UgrGyy7LLW https://t.co/U4qLB4FIlr

Last night the stench was so bad it drove me almost to a point of no return as I wanted to take my own action a certain lady spoke to me and stopped me from doing something really stupid thank u for helping me out and our family u no who u are

So Im locked in my.bedroom Fan on. Water, paracetamol,sick bucket. I shan't venture outside till.morning even if my bladder bursts because Walley is here @pow_rebecca @ClareDinnisEA @MPGeorgeEustice @MattHancock Does this sound like life to you? It is OUR life @PHE_uk @EnvAgency
